snippet: The party-line vote put on display an unusual alliance between some Democrats and Republicans on the role of Congress in deciding to go into battle.
abstract: Senate Foreign Relations Committee votes to authorize military campaign against Islamic State; 10-to-8 vote illuminates unexpected alliance between some Democrats and some Republicans in debate over role of Congress in making and approving decision to go to war.
lead_paragraph: The party-line vote put on display an unusual alliance between some Democrats and Republicans on the role of Congress in deciding to go into battle.

headline.main: Senate Panel Approves Limited Fight Against ISIS, Reopening War Powers Debate
headline.print_headline: Senate Panel Approves Limited ISIS Fight, Reviving War Powers Debate
